main event: A civilian airline pilot observed a flying object over White Plains, New York on June 22, 1953.
interesting points: The observation lasted for about 7-8 minutes., The object was described as circular and slightly elongated in shape., The object was dark in color and approximately 5 inches in diameter., The object was traveling at an estimated speed of 240 mph., The sighting was reported by the pilot of a Luscombe aircraft en route to Teterboro Airport.
